title: Lard Pastry Dough
ingredients: ½ cup lard, chilled and cut into bits
3 tablespoons butter, chilled and cut into bits
¼ to ⅓ cup ice water
instructions: In a large bowl blend the sifted flour, the salt, the lard, and the butter until the mixture resembles corn meal.  Gradually add the ice water, toss the mixture until the water is incorporated and forms the dough.  Form the dough into a ball.  Chill the dough, wrapped in wax paper, for one hour.
remarks: I assume that one can substitute Crisco or some other vegetable shortening for the lard. However, according to TV personality, Emril, one can occasionally indulge oneself, as long as one does so in moderation.
source: Summer Fruit Desserts, Gourmet Magazine, August 1978.
